title: iBaba
author: iBaba
content: We have read several information about how Bitcoiners should protect their private keys as your bitcoin security and protection remains the most imperative part of your Bitcoin life and assets. It is not overemphasized to always sort for more knowledge on how you can protect your bitcoin private keys as they are the most delicate alphanumericals that you can ever protect.Once someone is able to hack into your private key, it becomes easy to sweep your account within seconds. This is unlike the bank account passwords or Gmail passwords that will probably require some factor verifications.Never store your private key in any centralized or decentralized online data storage, none can be 100% trusted but the most salient part of this post is to bring our minds into this topic especially why it is important for you never to say your recovery seed or private key aloud because spy devices could be planted near you and will steal your information ASAP. Trust me when I say this isn't a satire as it is possible for Bezos to pick your private keys by using Alexa to record your keys, lols.Realize that self-serving voice activated services or microphone database such as Alexa and Siri amongst others can log everything and once someone is able to penetrate or hack into Amazon or Apple, your information could be shared into the Dark web or on Clearnet.So it is very important never to say your recovery seed out loud since you just can't figure out in this age, who's listening or watching you whilst you're alone in your bedroom with your gadgets. Don't mention your recovery seed in a phone conversation with a friend or family,  even when you're calling through end-to-end encrypted applications such as WhatsApp.Your gadgets could be the spy agents too.Lastly, whenever you work on your recovery seed, put your mobile phones in another room, put a tape over your webcams as an added security measures and never do anything with your Bitcoin in a public space like McDonald's or Chicken Republic that is full of listening devices. Don't be carried away.A photo of Mark Zuckerberg's computer Webcam covered with a masking tape will go a long way to solidify my claims.Source: https://abcnews.go.com/Technology/mark-zuckerberg-puts-tape-webcam/story?id=40040340

comments.body: Quote from: iBaba on November 08, 2023, 07:23:42 AMOnce someone is able to hack into your private key, it becomes easy to sweep your account within seconds. You are referring to 'wallet', not account. To be precise, you are referring to a noncustodial wallet.Quote from: iBaba on November 08, 2023, 07:23:42 AMNever store your private key in any centralized or decentralized online data storage, none can be 100% trustedJust like what happened to people that thought they encrypted their information on LastPass which many of the information were gotten access to recently The worst someone can do is to store their seed phrase or private key online. Some wallets are suggesting iCloiud or Google Cloud, but manual backup offline on a paper or metallic sheet like stainless steel or titanium is the best.

Using a wallet in an online device is a practice that should be discouraged because it is the fundamental that brings all these ways of exposing keys and seed phrase. You can expose your private keys and seed by downloading the wrong applications and malware, you can even download the wrong keyboard on your devices and when you have a wallet installed in it, the chances of becoming a victim will be high.QuoteSo it is very important never to say your recovery seed out loud since you just can't figure out in this age, who's listening or watching you whilst you're alone in your bedroom with your gadgets. Don't mention your recovery seed in a phone conversation with a friend or family,  even when you're calling through end-to-end encrypted applications such as WhatsApp.Your gadgets could be the spy agents too.Lastly, whenever you work on your recovery seed, put your mobile phones in another room, put a tape over your webcams as an added security measures and never do anything with your Bitcoin in a public space like McDonald's or Chicken Republic that is full of listening devices. Don't be carried away.What you don't know will kill you slowly without knowing where it's coming from, the best way to avoid this is to never use a wallet that's connected online, this is what most centralized exchanges do all the time, it's better to buy and used a hardware wallet or an air gap device to manage your seed phrase, private keys and sign transactions. There is no amount of peace that comes with when you do the right thing than taking a cure while doing the wrong thing.If you value your privacy, it's even better to use a hardware wallet than a coin that is coming from a centralized exchange because these days, the bitcoins are KYC and that is detrimental to your privacy, anyone can spy on what you do and how you spend your coins.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: In my religion  they say that faith comes by hearing, so it doesn't matter how many times that we hear an important information, it is still very good, because out of sight is out of mind. So it doesn't matter that we hear about keeping our passwords and seed phrase safe and secured every time, the information should be ever green in our memory. One of the essence of holding bitcoin, is to safeguard it in our wallet, and if our the wallet address is lost or compromised, then the bitcoin is at risk of been lost forever or stollen.The first wallet that I ever opened, which I ignorantly misplaced the piece of paper where I wrote the password that very day without knowing, and the seed phrase that I saw later wasn't complete, I still have the coinomi wallet and the bitcoin inside it, but I can not send it. I only use the bitcoin inside the wallet to see price fluctuations, nothing more. It is a very important and bitter lesson for me anytime that is open it. Now that bitcoin price is pumping, I can only watch it grow without selling it, probably forever.

comments.body: First of all Op exposing your private key is not something anyone would do ordinarily private keys being leaked or stolen is usually as a result of carelessness or ignorance which can be a result when newbies in the crypto space fail to get to understand crypto security properly before investing or as a result of scams or hacks.below is a chart from chain analysis of crypto stolen by hacks over the past 2016 -2022The simplest solution to prevent people from losing their private keys is to be more careful and improve their security levels.They should also try to make majority of Thier crypto related priors offline especially hodlings this can be achieved by making use of cold wallets like air gapped wallet which are totally offline.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Saying that you use an airgapped device that does not and will not connect to the Internet is the best. Some people believe that once the Internet is turned off, you are safe, or that your device is far from any Wi-Fi network while Bluetooth or USB is still working. I do not want to say that you should be skeptical about doing this in a dark room, but Possibilities such as zooming in on some phone cameras easily increase your concerns.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: No matter how reckless one could be toward their crypto recovery seed, they will find it hard to say their recovery seed loud. The mistake someone can make is not to write out their recovery seed on a piece of paper, giving out their recovery seed to scammers due to they don't know the importance or dangers of giving out their recovery seed to strangers. But if it is in the situation of someone announcing their recovery seed to others, that's the last thing most people do. By the way, the recovery seed in question is not what someone can recall all or sound meaningful or sweet to the ears of people that you would say, let you keep saying it loud to people for that sake

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Never ever do that you'll be storing it on a cloud storage. How many of us before that did it when we're too naive, young and new?But once you're already here for several years and you understand the risk that it has when you do that, you should know what's better and how you should keep it safely. Don't be so vulgar too to your friends and family about holding Bitcoin, that's the start of making yourself protected.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: It's a newbie that can openly flaunt their wallet secret phrase, and when they do, they will face the consequences of their action, which definitely will teach them to be very careful. There are always the strict rules of investing in Bitcoin, which are "not your key, not your coin." Because if you give out your private key to a third party, they can control your asset. I think that some people in the cryoto spaces learned to take their security very seriously. Like myself, I have experienced some issues with lost fun in my wallet, and that taught me to be very serious in terms of security.
